meanings.definition: To intimidate or dominate someone through aggressive behavior.
meanings.sent1: The big kid tried to outbullies the smaller children on the playground.
meanings.sent2: The bully always tries to outbullies others to feel powerful.
meanings.sent3: The little dog tried to outbullies the big dog, but it was just funny to watch.
meanings.sent4: In the world of insects, the queen ant outbullies all the worker ants.
meanings.sent5: The villain in the movie outbullies everyone with their evil plans.

meanings.sent1: She always manages to outbullies her classmates with her mean comments.
meanings.sent2: The aggressive student tries to outbullies others to show dominance.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to outbullies the dog, but the dog just wagged its tail.
meanings.sent4: The older brother outbullies his younger siblings when it comes to getting what he wants.
meanings.sent5: The team captain outbullies the other players with their commanding presence.
